companies.name: California Thistle
companies.description:
Appearance: The plant typically has spiny leaves and will contain purple, pink, or even white flowers that are small and can bloom in a cluster. The flowers are fragrant and attractive to pollinators like bees and butterflies.
Height: The size depends on the species but averages from around 12 inches to 4.9 feet tall! .
Leaves: Leaves can be identified as having spines and lobed in apperance , which can sometimes have a rose-like apperance at the base.
companies.caretips:
Soil: Handles a wide variety of soil but will usually prefer moist and fertile type soil. 
 Sunlight: Full sun is the most beneficial but can survive living in less sunlight and more shaded sections. 
 Watering: It can tolerate drought like conditions but will benefit from moderate to heavy watering.

companies.name: Alphine Strawberry
companies.description:
Appearance: The plant can have white or pink flowers that will bloom in the spring time with fruit that resembles the appearance of stawberries but much smaller only around 1/2 inch in diameter. 
 Height: The plant is typically found on the ground and only reaching around 6-12 inches that spread and can be used for create ground cover in gardens! 
 Harvest: This plant can be harvested as it produces fruit that can be taken in latte spring through early summer and can simply be picked!
companies.caretips:
Soil: Enjoys well-drained and sandy loam ground with a pH around 5.5 to 7.0. 
 Sunlight: Can thrive in partial or in full sun, and some shade can be tolerable. 
 Watering: Heavy watering necessary but do not overwater.

companies.name: Barnyard Grass
companies.description:
Appearance: The plant will usually have a smooth and hairless stem that can be green or red tint. The leaves are long and flat with a rough texture. 
 Uses: Considered a weed however used for animal foliage for livestock like horses, cows, and goats.
companies.caretips:
Management: Typically mulching and mowing are used to deal with the rapid growth rate when one singular plant will produce up to thousands of seeds. 
 Additional Use: can be used for erosion control since it grows fast and can hold together loose soil.
